com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine

Class SpenObjectRuntime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine.SpenObjectRuntime

  • public class SpenObjectRuntime
extends Object
    ObjectRuntime class This class contains methods for controlling ObjectRuntime.
    To use this class, create an instance using ObjectRuntimeManager.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SpenObjectRuntime.UpdateListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for Spen ObjectRuntime update events.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Get the ObjectRuntime type
        ObjectRuntime is processed according to its type. 
         For example:
 SpenObjectRuntimeManager orm = new SpenObjectRuntimeManager(mContext);
 ArrayList orList = new ArrayList();
 orm.getObjectRuntimeInfoList(orList);
 SpenObjectRuntime object = orm.createObjectRuntime(orList.get(which));
 SpenObjectBase objectBase = null;
 switch (object.getType()) {
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_NONE:
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_IMAGE:
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_STROKE:
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_CONTAINER:
 break;
 }
        Returns:
        The valid values are SpenObjectRuntime
        SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_NONE SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_IMAGE SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_STROKE SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_CONTAINER
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • start

        public void start(Object objectBase,
                  RectF relativeRect,
                  PointF pan,
                  float zoomRatio,
                  PointF frameStartPosition,
                  ViewGroup layout)
        Start ObjectRuntime with the specified values. 
         For example:
 SpenObjectRuntimeManager orm = new SpenObjectRuntimeManager(mContext);
 ArrayList orList = new ArrayList();
 orm.getObjectRuntimeInfoList(orList);
 SpenObjectRuntime object = orm.createObjectRuntime(orList.get(which));
 SpenObjectBase objectBase = null;
 switch (object.getType()) {
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_NONE:
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_IMAGE:
 objectBase = new SpenObjectImage();
 SpenObjectImage objectImage = (SpenObjectImage) objectBase;
 objectImage.setResizeOption(SpenObjectBase.RESIZE_OPTION_KEEP_RATIO);
 objectImage.setRotatable(false);
 objectImage.setExtraDataInt("Type", SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_IMAGE);
 objectImage.setLineBorderColor(Color.BLACK);
 objectImage.setLineBorderWidth(10);
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_STROKE:
 break;
 case SpenObjectRuntimeInterface.TYPE_CONTAINER:
 break;
 }
 object.setListener(objectRuntimelistener);
 object.onStart(objectBase, rect, null, 0, null, layout);
        Parameters:
        objectBase - The Object used in ObjectRuntime
        relativeRect - The relative rectangle
        pan - The relative position
        zoomRatio - The zoom ratio
        frameStartPosition - The ObjectRuntime position in the canvas
        layout - The ObjectRuntime Viewgroup
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if objectBase or relativeRect or frameStartPosition or ViewGroup is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean cancel)
        Stop ObjectRuntime
        Parameters:
        cancel - This parameter is used for specific ObjectRuntime. Default is TRUE. If this value is false, ObjectRuntime will action according to it.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • onTouchEvent

        public void onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
        Called when ObjectRuntime touch events occur.
        Parameters:
        event - The event information
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setRect

        public void setRect(RectF rect)
        Set the specified rectangle for ObjectRuntime
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setListener

        public boolean setListener(SpenObjectRuntime.UpdateListener listener)
        Set the specified UpdateListener instance to receive ObjectRuntime update events. 
         For example:
 SpenObjectRuntimeManager orm = new SpenObjectRuntimeManager(mContext);
 ArrayList orList = new ArrayList();
 orm.getObjectRuntimeInfoList(orList);
 SpenObjectRuntime object = orm.createObjectRuntime(orList.get(which));
 object.setListener(objectRuntimelistener);
        Parameters:
        listener - The UpdateListener instance to receive ObjectRuntime update events.
        Returns:
        • true - if the specified listener is set successfully. • false – if the listener is not set
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        SpenObjectRuntime.UpdateListener
